did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Director's Correspondence and Subject Files of the Virginia Department of Business Administration, 1992-1998

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Dept. of Business Assistance. Director's correspondence and subject files, [cite specific accession and dates used]. State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession 42707 was transferred by Linda Baumgarner on June 12, 2006.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed using minimal processing procedures.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Department of Business Assistance was created by act of the Virginia General Assembly in July of 1996 by codifying § 2.2-900 of the Code of Virginia. The impetus for its creation was a June 1994 economic planning initiative launched by Governor George F. Allen and known as Opportunity Virginia: A Strategic Plan for Jobs and Prosperity. Upon the agency's creation, it and the Virginia Economic Development Partnership divided the activities of the then Virginia Department of Economic Development which was then disbanded. The Department of Business Assistance operated until 2013, when it was consolidated along with the Department of Minority Business Enterprise into the Department of Small Business and Supplier Diversity.

The Department of Business Assistance was intended to serve as a one-stop government clearinghouse for business resources, financing and small business assistance programs. Its mission was to promote economic growth and development within the Commonwealth. It worked with new and existing businesses to provide workforce training and recruitment, loans, business information, procurement assistance, counseling, and educational opportunities for businesses. The Director of the Department of Business Assistance was appointed by the Governor and served at their pleasure.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains mostly memorandums and outgoing correspondence from David G. Dickson when he served as Director of Community and Business Services within the Dept. of Economic Development, between January 1992 and December 1998. Dickson was later Director of Existing Industry Development, and was appointed the first director of the Dept. of Business Assistance in 1996 by Governor George Allen. This accession also includes correspondence from Elizabeth J. Moran, Manager of Community Services in the Dept. of Economic Development.
